page.title: 18Luddington Church
page.content: The present church dedicated to the patron Saint Oswald was built in 1845 although churches had been built on the site previously,one as early as 1300. The church is built on a rise outside the village as it was built to serve both Luddington and Garthorpe.It is in a traditional cruciform style with some stained glass windows. It contains some "free"pews dating back to when people paid for their pews to show their standing(or not) in the village. A Sunday School is held each week with ten regular attenders,only one a boy! There is 1 service a week at the church with times varying according to a set programme as Luddington is now part of the "North Axholme Group"which includes 3 other villages.
